API Docs for Sandy 3D Engine haXe Port, ver. 3.1.1

sandy.core.scenegraph.Shape3D

type
class
extends
ATransformable
implements
IDisplayable
subclasses
sandy.extrusion.Extrusion, sandy.primitive.Box, sandy.primitive.Cylinder, sandy.primitive.GeodesicSphere, sandy.primitive.Hedra, sandy.primitive.KeyFramedShape3D, sandy.primitive.Line3D, sandy.primitive.Plane3D, sandy.primitive.Sphere, sandy.primitive.Torus
The Shape3D class is the base class of all true 3D shapes.

It represents a node in the object tree of the world.
A Shape3D is a leaf node and can not have any child nodes.

It must be the child of a branch group or a transform group, but transformations can be applied to the Shape directly.

Static Variables

SORT_AVGZ(inline,null) : Int

Average distance sorting. Default sorting mode. Carefully designed models will display just fine, but ordering problems are common. This is also the only possible sorting mode with useSingleContainer set to false.

SORT_CUSTOM_BSP(inline,null) : Int

In this mode mesh is sorted using BSP tree, but no tree is built for you (you need to set bsp property yourself). Experimental.

SORT_LAZY_BSP(inline,null) : Int

In this mode mesh is sorted using BSP tree, but no faces are split for you (means sorting problems are still possible). Experimental.

SORT_NONE(inline,null) : Int

No sorting. Only convex shapes are guaranteed to display correctly in this mode.

Constructor

new()
parameters
p_sName A string identifier for this object
p_oGeometry The geometry of this object
p_oAppearance The appearance of this object. If no apperance is given, the DEFAULT_APPEARANCE will be applied.
p_bUseSingleContainer Whether tis object should use a single container to draw on
Creates a 3D object

This creates a new 3D geometry object. That object will handle the rendering of a static Geometry3D object into a real 3D object and finally to the 2D camera representation.

animated : Bool

Animated flag.

If the geometry vertices are dynamically modified by some animation engine or mathematic function, some polygon may disapear with no reason. The normal Point3D is used to compute the polygon visibility, and if you don't update the normal Point3D after the vertices modifications, there's an error. To fix that problem, Sandy3D offers that new property appeared in 3.0.3 release, which once set to true, automatically update the normal Point3Ds for you. As a performance warning, don't set this value to true if your model geometry isn't animated.

clear(default,method) : Void -> Void

Clears the graphics object of this object's container.

The the graphics that were drawn on the Graphics object is erased, and the fill and line style settings are reset.

clone(default,method) : ?p_sName : String -> ?p_bKeepTransform : Bool -> Shape3D

This method returns a clone of this Shape3D. The current appearance will be applied, and the geometry is cloned (not referenced to curent one).

container(__getContainer,null) : flash.display.Sprite

The container for this object. This container property exist if the useSingleContainer is set to true. It is a direct access to the Shape3D container to, for example, apply nice effects such as filters etc.

cull(default,method) : p_oFrustum : sandy.view.Frustum -> p_oViewMatrix : sandy.core.data.Matrix4 -> p_bChanged : Bool -> Void

Tests this node against the camera frustum to get its visibility.

If this node and its children are not within the frustum, the node is set to cull and it would not be displayed.

The method also updates the bounding volumes to make the more accurate culling system possible.
First the bounding sphere is updated, and if intersecting, the bounding box is updated to perform the more precise culling.

MANDATORY The update method must be called first!

cull(default,method) : p_oFrustum : sandy.view.Frustum -> p_oViewMatrix : sandy.core.data.Matrix4 -> p_bChanged : Bool -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Tests this node against the frustum volume to get its visibility.

If the node and its children aren't in the frustum, the node is set to cull and will not be displayed.

The method also updates the bounding volumes, to make a more accurate culling system possible.
First the bounding sphere is updated, and if intersecting, the bounding box is updated to perform a more precise culling.

MANDATORY The update method must be called first!

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node

depth(__getDepth,__setDepth) : Float

The depth of this object. In case the useSingleContainer mode is enabled (default mode), this value returns the means depth of the Shape in the camera frame. This value is mainly used as a z-sorting value.

The method makes recursive calls to the destroy method of the child nodes.

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable

display(default,method) : ?p_oContainer : flash.display.Sprite -> Void

Performs a z-sorting and renders the objects visible polygons.

The method is called only if the object renders on a single container
- ( useSingleContainer = true ).

enableBackFaceCulling(__getEnableBackFaceCulling,__setEnableBackFaceCulling) : Bool

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Specifies whether back face culling be enabled for this object. If set to false all faces of this object are drawn. A true value enables the back face culling algorithm - Default true

enableBackFaceCulling(__getEnableBackFaceCulling,__setEnableBackFaceCulling) : Bool

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Specifies whether back face culling be enabled for this object. If set to false all faces of this object are drawn. A true value enables the back face culling algorithm - Default true

enableClipping(__getEnableClipping,__setEnableClipping) : Bool

Enable the Frustum clipping on the visible polygons. Enable this when you need a perfect intersection between the camera and some object shapes. In case you need to make the camera look inside and outide a box, or other immerssive things.

Important: Enable the clipping makes process a bit slower, especially with big scenes.

Specify if this object polygons should be clipped against the camera frustum planes.

enableEvents(__getEnableEvents,__setEnableEvents) : Bool

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Enables the event system for mouse events.

When set to true, the onPress, onRollOver and onRollOut events are broadcast.
The event system is enabled or disabled for all faces of this object.
As an alternative, you have the possibility to enable events only for specific faces.

Once this feature is enabled, the animation is more CPU intensive.

Example var l_oShape:Shape3D = new Sphere("sphere"); l_oShape.enableEvents = true; l_oShape.addEventListener( MouseEvent.CLICK, onClick ); function onClick( p_eEvent:Shape3DEvent ):void { var l_oPoly:Polygon = ( p_eEvent.polygon ); var l_oPointAtClick:Point3D = p_eEvent.point; // -- get the normalized uv of the point under mouse position var l_oIntersectionUV:UVCoord = p_eEvent.uv; // -- get the correct material var l_oMaterial:BitmapMaterial = (l_oPoly.visible ? l_oPoly.appearance.frontMaterial : l_oPoly.appearance.backMaterial) as BitmapMaterial; }

enableEvents(__getEnableEvents,__setEnableEvents) : Bool

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Enables the event system for mouse events.

When set to true, the onPress, onRollOver and onRollOut events are broadcast.
The event system is enabled or disabled for all faces of this object.
As an alternative, you have the possibility to enable events only for specific faces.

Once this feature is enabled, the animation is more CPU intensive.

Example var l_oShape:Shape3D = new Sphere("sphere"); l_oShape.enableEvents = true; l_oShape.addEventListener( MouseEvent.CLICK, onClick ); function onClick( p_eEvent:Shape3DEvent ):void { var l_oPoly:Polygon = ( p_eEvent.polygon ); var l_oPointAtClick:Point3D = p_eEvent.point; // -- get the normalized uv of the point under mouse position var l_oIntersectionUV:UVCoord = p_eEvent.uv; // -- get the correct material var l_oMaterial:BitmapMaterial = (l_oPoly.visible ? l_oPoly.appearance.frontMaterial : l_oPoly.appearance.backMaterial) as BitmapMaterial; }

enableForcedDepth : Bool

Should forced depth be enable for this object?.

If true it is possible to force this object to be drawn at a specific depth,
if false the normal Z-sorting algorithm is applied.

When correctly used, this feature allows you to aVoid some Z-sorting problems.

enableInteractivity(__getEnableInteractivity,__setEnableInteractivity) : Bool

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Enable the interactivity on this shape and its polygon. Be careful, this mode have some requirements : - to have useSingleContainer set to false. It is done automatically if enabled The original settings are back to their original state when the mode is disabled

enableInteractivity(__getEnableInteractivity,__setEnableInteractivity) : Bool

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Enable the interactivity on this shape and its polygon. Be careful, this mode have some requirements : - to have useSingleContainer set to false. It is done automatically if enabled The original settings are back to their original state when the mode is disabled

enableNearClipping : Bool

Enable the Frustum near plane clipping on the visible polygons. Enable this when you need a perfect intersection between the front camera plane. This is mainly used when you need the camera to move on a long plane.

Important: Enable the clipping makes process a bit slower, especially with big scenes.

forcedDepth : Float

The forced depth for this object.

To make this feature work, you must enable the ForcedDepth system too.
The higher the depth is, the sooner the more far the object will be represented.

geometry(__getGeometry,__setGeometry) : Geometry3D

The geometry of this object.

geometryCenter(__getGeometryCenter,__setGeometryCenter) : sandy.core.data.Point3D

Change the geometryCenter of the Shape3D. To change the geometryCenter point of a shape, simply set this geometryCenter property. The geometryCenter property requires a Point3D. This Point3D is an position offset relative to the original geometry one. For example, a Sphere primitive creates automatically a geometry which center is the 0,0,0 position. If you rotate this sphere as this, it will rotate around its center. Now if you set the geometryCenter property, this rotation center will change. The updateBoundingVolumes method which does update the bounding volumes to enable a correct frustum culling is automatically called.

getLookAt(default,method) : Void -> sandy.core.data.Point3D

getPosition(default,method) : ?p_eMode : sandy.CoordinateSystem -> sandy.core.data.Point3D

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Returns the position of this group or object.

Choose which coordinate system the returned position refers to, by passing a mode string:
The position is returned as a vector in one of the following:
If LOCAL, the position is coordinates of the parent frame. If ABSOLUTE the position is in world coordinates If CAMERA the position is relative to the camera's coordinate system. Default value is LOCAL

For example, this allows replacement of the objects in the correct camera frame before projection

Normally used when this object is a camera

matrix(__getMatrix,__setMatrix) : sandy.core.data.Matrix4

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
This property allows you to directly set the matrix you want to a transformable object. But be careful with its use. It modifies the rotation AND the position. WARNING : Please remove any scale from this matrix. This is not managed yet. WARNING : Please think about call initFrame before changing this frame. Without calling this method first, the frame will stay local, and the transformation will be applied locally.

moveForward(default,method) : p_nD : Float -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Translates this object along its forward vector ( local z ) in the parent frame.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a step forward
in the direction you look, not always horizontally!

moveHorizontally(default,method) : p_nD : Float -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Translates this object parallel to its parent zx plane and in its forward direction.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a step in the forward direction, but without changing your altitude ( constant global z ).

moveLateraly(default,method) : p_nD : Float -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Translates this object laterally in its parent frame.

This is a translation in the parents x direction.

moveSideways(default,method) : p_nD : Float -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Translates this object along its side vector ( local x ) in the parent frame.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a step to your right or to your left

moveUpwards(default,method) : p_nD : Float -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Translates this object along its up vector ( local y ) in the parent frame.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a step up or down
in the direction of your body, not always vertically!

moveVertically(default,method) : p_nD : Float -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Translates this object vertically in ots parent frame.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a strictly vertical step, ( in the global y direction )

pan(__getPan,__setPan) : Float

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Pans this object around the local y axis.

The pan angle interval is 0 to 360 degrees
Directions within the parent frame are: North = 0, East = 90, South = 180 nad West = 270 degrees.

perform(default,method) : p_iOperation : INodeOperation -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Performs an operation on this node and all of its children.

Traverses the subtree made up of this node and all of its children. While traversing the subtree, individual operations are performed on entry and exit of each node of the subtree.

Implements the visitor design pattern: Using the visitor design pattern, you can define a new operation on Node and its subclasses without having to change the classes and without having to take care of traversing the node tree.

perform(default,method) : p_iOperation : INodeOperation -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Performs an operation on this node and all of its children.

Traverses the subtree made up of this node and all of its children. While traversing the subtree, individual operations are performed on entry and exit of each node of the subtree.

Implements the visitor design pattern: Using the visitor design pattern, you can define a new operation on Node and its subclasses without having to change the classes and without having to take care of traversing the node tree.

remove(default,method) : Void -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Removes this node from the node tree, saving its child nodes.

NOTE that remove method only remove the current node and NOT its children!
To remove the current node and all its children please refer to the destroy method.

The child nodes of this node becomes child nodes of this node's parent.

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node

removeChild(default,method) : p_oNode : Node -> Node

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Removes the specified child. All children of the node you want to remove are lost. The link between them and the rest of the tree is broken, so they will not be rendered anymore. The object itself and its children are still in memory, if you want to free them completely, call child.destroy()

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node

The object itself and its children are still in memory, if you want to free them completely, call child.destroy()

resetCoords(default,method) : Void -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable

roll(__getRoll,__setRoll) : Float

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Rolls this object around the local z axis.

The roll angle interval is -180 to +180 degrees
At 0 degrees the local x axis is aligned with the horizon of its parent
Full roll right = 180 and full roll left = -180 degrees ( upside down ).

rotateAxis(default,method) : p_nX : Float -> p_nY : Float -> p_nZ : Float -> p_nAngle : Float -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Rotate this object around the specified axis in the parent frame by the specified angle.

NOTE : The axis will be normalized automatically.

rotateX(__getRotateX,__setRotateX) : Float

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Rotates this object around an axis parallel to the parents x axis.

The object rotates a specified angle ( degrees ) around an axis through the objects reference point, paralell to the x axis of the parent frame.

rotateY(__getRotateY,__setRotateY) : Float

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Rotates this object around an axis parallel to the parents y axis.

The object rotates a specified angle ( degrees ) around an axis through the objects reference point, parallel to the y axis of the parent frame.

rotateZ(__getRotateZ,__setRotateZ) : Float

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Rotates this object around an axis paralell to the parents z axis.

The object rotates a specified angle ( degrees ) around an axis through the objects reference point, paralell to the z axis of the parent frame.

scaleX(__getScaleX,__setScaleX) : Float

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
x scale of this object.

A value of 1 scales to the original x scale, a value of 2 doubles the x scale.
NOTE : This value does not affect the camera object.

scaleY(__getScaleY,__setScaleY) : Float

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
y scale of this object.

A value of 1 scales to the original y scale, a value of 2 doubles the y scale.
NOTE : This value does not affect the camera object.

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable

A value of 1 scales to the original z scale, a value of 2 doubles the z scale.

sortingMode(__getSortingMode,__setSortingMode) : Int

Faces sorting method. With useSingleContainer set to false only SORT_AVGZ is possible.

swapCulling(default,method) : Void -> Void

Changes the backface culling side. When you want to display a cube and you are outside the cube, you see its external faces.
The internal faces are not drawn due to back face culling In case you are inside the cube, by default Sandy's engine still doesn't draw the internal faces (because you should not be in there). If you need to be only inside the cube, you can call this method to change which side is culled. The faces will be visible only from the interior of the cube. If you want to be both on the inside and the outside, you want to make the faces visible from on both sides. In that case you just have to set enableBackFaceCulling to false.

swapParent(default,method) : p_oNewParent : Node -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Moves this node to another parent node.

This node is removed from its current parent node, and added as a child of the specified node

swapParent(default,method) : p_oNewParent : Node -> Void

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Moves this node to another parent node.

This node is removed from its current parent node, and added as a child of the specified node

tilt(__getTilt,__setTilt) : Float

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.ATransformable
Tilts this object around the local x axis.

The tilt angle interval is -90 to +90 degrees
At 0 degrees the local z axis is paralell to the zx plane of its parent coordinate system.
Straight up = +90 and stright down = -90 degrees.

useSingleContainer(__getUseSingleContainer,__setUseSingleContainer) : Bool

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Property that changes the way to render this object, Set to true, the shape will be rendered into a single Sprite object, which is accessible through the container property. Set to false, the container property does not target anything, but all the polygons will be rendered into their own dedicated container.

If true, this object renders itself on a single container ( Sprite ),
if false, each polygon is rendered on its own container.

useSingleContainer(__getUseSingleContainer,__setUseSingleContainer) : Bool

inherited from sandy.core.scenegraph.Node
Property that changes the way to render this object, Set to true, the shape will be rendered into a single Sprite object, which is accessible through the container property. Set to false, the container property does not target anything, but all the polygons will be rendered into their own dedicated container.

If true, this object renders itself on a single container ( Sprite ),
if false, each polygon is rendered on its own container.
